TopicTitle: What do you think about Godus

Articles.Content: Recently i bought Galaxy S3 i saw on Google store Godus i think that it was pay application but it's free :-)

Yup, agreed. It's boring and you're not a strong enough god. Changing the terrain is something any human can do, just give 'em tools.

I once met someone in a KMP server who was extremely hyped for this game, made me a little hyped, but today it's probably like someone slapped his face.

From Wikipedia:

Despite the success of his games, both critical and financial, Molyneux has acquired a reputation for issuing over-enthusiastic descriptions of games under development, which are found to be somewhat less ambitious when released. This goes back to Black & White, though the most well-known case of this was with Fable, released in 2004 without many of the features talked about by Molyneux in press interviews during development. After the release, Molyneux publicly apologized for overhyping the game. In February 2014 he is quoted as being "Ashamed of the final product [Fable 3] and I never want to work with Microsoft again."

I've met the guy, and he's incredibly nice, but I've also played many of his games, and yeah, they rarely live up to the hype.
It's a good concept but the execution is very poor.
I tried it last night, and it crashes constantly.

I'll just leave this here:

http://www.pcgamer.com/godus-designer-admits-kickstarter-promises-likely-cant-be-kept/

Molyneux has moved on again it seems.

and, again, he left us with broken promises.

i loved this guys work way back in the bullfrog time. but people just have to stop give him creds on his name alone.. its over.

It's awful.

As above, it's horrible.

I expected something like Populous.

And then 22Cans took everything I loved about Populous, threw it in a puddle of mud and rolled over it with a steamroller, honking. Well, thanks for that.

I had it on my Samsung Galaxy S33, i have mixed feeling at first, because many people complain about it, but i even liked it.

Now i thinking about buying it on steam but 9.99 EUR is to expansive for that game IMHO i wait for let we say 50-70% discount

But it looks promising, i wonder does it will have modern age?

Might want to check back in your other, identically titled thread about godus?

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/101744-What-do-you-think-about-Godus

I doubt it will have much updates from here on personally.

But at least someone in the industry finally asked Peter Molyneux what many of us have been wondering, namely is he a pathalogical liar?
